newsitem.title: FRANCE: Gaz de France says could extend oil company pacts.
newsitem.headline: Gaz de France says could extend oil company pacts.

text.p: Gaz de France said it could extend its exploration cooperation pacts with oil groups Statoil and Unocal beyond the deals being discussed with Elf-Aquitaine and Total.

In papers handed out before a news conference on the company's 1996 results, the state-owned gas group said that during the year it had become increasingly involved in ad hoc partnerships for gas exploration and in studies for electricty production using gas.

"These partnerships, which will give us new experiences and competences while we share the risks as well as the profits related to the operations, can be realised notably with Electricite de France or with oil companies such as Elf, Total, Statoil or Unocal," it said.
Gaz de France in January signed a framework cooperation with Elf.
